planets.name: Mercury
planets.description: Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun and is known for its extreme temperature variations.

planets.name: Venus
planets.description: Venus is often called Earth's 'sister planet' due to its similar size and composition, but it has a thick, toxic atmosphere.

planets.name: Earth
planets.description: Earth is our home planet and the only known celestial body to support life.

planets.name: Mars
planets.description: Mars is often referred to as the 'Red Planet' and has been a target for human exploration.

planets.name: Jupiter
planets.description: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system and is known for its massive size and powerful storms.

planets.name: Saturn
planets.description: Saturn is famous for its stunning ring system, made up of countless particles of ice and rock.

planets.name: Uranus
planets.description: Uranus is a unique planet in our solar system as it rotates on its side, unlike other planets.

planets.name: Neptune
planets.description: Neptune is the farthest known planet from the Sun and is a gas giant with a deep blue color.
